text: Paul Michael Romer (born November 7, 1955) is an American economist. He is known for creating the endogenous growth theory. He won the Nobel Prize in Economics in 2018 alongside William Nordhaus. He was Chief Economist and Senior Vice President of the World Bank until he resigned in January 2018.Donnan S. Outspoken World Bank chief economist Paul Romer exits // FT. January 24, 2018. He had been on leave from his position as professor of economics at the Stern School of Business at New York University. His father is former Governor of Colorado Roy Romer. ==References== Category:1955 births Category:Living people Category:American economists Category:New York University faculty Category:Writers from Denver
